page.title: 18HOOK NORTON-LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The Hook Norton section of the Banbury/ Cheltenham railway line was last of all to be built because of the rocky hills. The station was in Austin's Way. There was a train called "Hook Norton", another "Hook Norton Manor". This section was opened in l887 and closed in l957. The people had to use dynamite to blow up the ironstone to make a path for the track. It took 4 years to build the Hooky section. They had to build very big pillars which are made of limestone.Each stone was hand cut. Two men got knocked off the top when the crane swung round. One grave is in Hook Norton churchyard. The railway's main business was the ironstone works. The railway was closed because it wasn't making money. There was a storm and the viaducts became dangerous and so the track was taken up in l965.
